English: The sun is shining today.
Danish: Solen skinner i dag.

English: She runs five miles every morning.
Danish: Hun løber fem miles hver morgen.

English: My favorite color is blue.
Danish: Min yndlingsfarve er blå.

English: They are planning a surprise party.
Danish: De planlægger en overraskelsesfest.

English: He plays the guitar very well.
Danish: Han spiller guitar meget godt.

English: We need to finish this project by Friday.
Danish: Vi skal færdiggøre dette projekt inden fredag.

English: Have you seen that new movie yet?
Danish: Har du set den nye film endnu?

English: She speaks three languages fluently.
Danish: Hun taler tre sprog flydende.

English: The cat always sleeps on the sofa.
Danish: Katten sover altid på sofaen.

English: I love eating pizza with extra cheese.
Danish: Jeg elsker at spise pizza med ekstra ost.

English: He enjoys listening to classical music.
Danish: Han nyder at lytte til klassisk musik.

English: The meeting starts at 9 AM sharp.
Danish: Mødet starter præcis kl. 9.

English: Do you have any plans for the weekend?
Danish: Har du nogle planer for weekenden?

English: She bought a new dress for the party.
Danish: Hun købte en ny kjole til festen.

English: We should take a walk in the park.
Danish: Vi burde tage en tur i parken.

English: The book you lent me was fascinating.
Danish: Bogen, du lånte mig, var fascinerende.

English: He always forgets his keys at home.
Danish: Han glemmer altid sine nøgler derhjemme.

English: She wants to travel around the world.
Danish: Hun vil gerne rejse rundt omkring i verden.

English: This restaurant serves delicious food.
Danish: Denne restaurant serverer lækker mad.

English: They are painting their house this weekend.
Danish: De maler deres hus denne weekend.

English: Have you ever been to Paris before?
Danish: Har du nogensinde været i Paris før?

English: He needs to finish his homework first.
Danish: Han skal først færdiggøre sine lektier.

English: She is learning how to play the piano.
Danish: Hun lærer at spille klaver.

English: Let's meet at the cafe around 5 PM.
Danish: Lad os mødes på cafeen omkring kl. 17.

English: I prefer tea over coffee in the morning.
Danish: Jeg foretrækker te frem for kaffe om morgenen.

English: He is studying hard for his exams.
Danish: Han studerer hårdt til sine eksamener.

English: The concert was absolutely amazing!
Danish: Koncerten var helt fantastisk!

English: She needs more time to finish the report.
Danish: Hun har brug for mere tid til at færdiggøre rapporten.

English: They live in a beautiful house by the lake.
Danish: De bor i et smukt hus ved søen.

English: Do you know how to swim?
Danish: Kan du svømme?

English: The weather forecast predicts rain tomorrow.
Danish: Vejrudsigten forudsiger regn i morgen.

English: He likes to go jogging every evening.
Danish: Han kan godt lide at jogge hver aften.

English: She is allergic to peanuts and shellfish.
Danish: Hun er allergisk overfor peanuts og skaldyr.

English: The museum exhibits ancient artifacts.
Danish: Museet udstiller gamle artefakter.

English: Let's have dinner together tonight.
Danish: Lad os spise middag sammen i aften.

English: He wants to buy a new car next year.
Danish: Han vil købe en ny bil næste år.

English: She was awarded a scholarship for her studies.
Danish: Hun blev tildelt et legat til sine studier.

English: The children are playing in the garden.
Danish: Børnene leger i haven.

English: I enjoy reading books in my spare time.
Danish: Jeg nyder at læse bøger i min fritid.

English: He's been working at the company for 10 years.
Danish: Han har arbejdet i virksomheden i 10 år.

English: She volunteers at the local animal shelter.
Danish: Hun arbejder som frivillig på det lokale dyreinternat.

English: Do you have any siblings?
Danish: Har du nogen søskende?

English: They are renovating their kitchen this summer.
Danish: De renoverer deres køkken denne sommer.

English: The movie starts in half an hour.
Danish: Filmen starter om en halv time.

English: She bought fresh flowers for the dining table.
Danish: Hun købte friske blomster til spisebordet.

English: He prefers to take the bus to work.
Danish: Han foretrækker at tage bussen på arbejde.

English: This jacket is on sale for half price.
Danish: Denne jakke er på tilbud til halv pris.

English: She practices yoga every morning.
Danish: Hun praktiserer yoga hver morgen.

English: We need to clean the garage this weekend.
Danish: Vi skal rydde op i garagen denne weekend.

English: He's going to visit his grandparents next week.
Danish: Han skal besøge sine bedsteforældre næste uge.

English: She enjoys watching documentaries about nature.
Danish: Hun nyder at se dokumentarfilm om naturen.

English: The new restaurant opened last month.
Danish: Den nye restaurant åbnede sidste måned.

English: Do you like spicy food?
Danish: Kan du lide stærk mad?

English: He plays soccer with his friends every Sunday.
Danish: Han spiller fodbold med sine venner hver søndag.

English: She needs to buy groceries for the week.
Danish: Hun skal købe dagligvarer for ugen.

English: They are celebrating their anniversary tonight.
Danish: De fejrer deres jubilæum i aften.

English: Have you read any good books lately?
Danish: Har du læst nogle gode bøger på det sidste?

English: She wants to learn how to bake a cake.
Danish: Hun vil gerne lære at bage en kage.

English: He's going to propose to his girlfriend soon.
Danish: Han vil snart fri til sin kæreste.

English: We should plan a vacation for next summer.
Danish: Vi burde planlægge en ferie til næste sommer.

English: She listens to music while she works.
Danish: Hun lytter til musik mens hun arbejder.

English: Do you know how to ski?
Danish: Kan du stå på ski?

English: He's trying to quit smoking this year.
Danish: Han forsøger at stoppe med at ryge i år.

English: She enjoys going for long walks in the park.
Danish: Hun nyder at gå lange ture i parken.

English: They are attending a conference next month.
Danish: De deltager i en konference næste måned.

English: Have you seen the latest episode of that TV show?
Danish: Har du set den seneste episode af den TV-serie?

English: She wants to adopt a rescue dog from the shelter.
Danish: Hun vil adoptere en redningshund fra internatet.

English: He's learning how to play chess online.
Danish: Han lærer at spille skak online.

English: She needs to book a flight for her business trip.
Danish: Hun skal bestille en flyrejse til sin forretningsrejse.

English: We should organize a barbecue this weekend.
Danish: Vi burde arrangere en grillfest denne weekend.

English: He's planning to start his own business.
Danish: Han planlægger at starte sin egen virksomhed.

English: She enjoys going to the gym after work.
Danish: Hun nyder at gå i fitnesscentret efter arbejde.

English: They are redecorating their living room.
Danish: De er i gang med at omdekorere deres stue.

English: Have you tried the new restaurant downtown?
Danish: Har du prøvet den nye restaurant i centrum?

English: She's going to study abroad next semester.
Danish: Hun skal studere i udlandet næste semester.

English: He enjoys watching sports on TV.
Danish: Han nyder at se sport i fjernsynet.

English: They need to buy new furniture for the office.
Danish: De skal købe nyt møbler til kontoret.

English: Do you want to go for a walk in the park?
Danish: Vil du med ud at gå en tur i parken?

English: She's learning how to knit in her spare time.
Danish: Hun lærer at strikke i sin fritid.

English: He's trying to learn how to cook Thai food.
Danish: Han prøver at lære at lave thailandsk mad.

English: We should try that new cafe downtown.
Danish: Vi burde prøve den nye cafe i centrum.

English: She's planning to take a photography course.
Danish: Hun planlægger at tage et fotokursus.

English: He likes to read the news online every morning.
Danish: Han kan godt lide at læse nyheder online hver morgen.

English: They are renovating their bathroom next month.
Danish: De renoverer deres badeværelse næste måned.

English: Have you ever been to a music festival?
Danish: Har du nogensinde været til en musikfestival?

English: She wants to learn how to dance salsa.
Danish: Hun vil gerne lære at danse salsa.

English: He enjoys going fishing on weekends.
Danish: Han nyder at gå ud og fiske i weekenderne.
